explanation: a person who helps someone else to commit a crime or to do something morally wrong
sentence: The thieves and two accomplices made away with over $25,000 in cash.
sentence_gap: The thieves and two ___________ made away with over $25,000 in cash.

explanation: happening or being planned or prepared
sentence: There are plans afoot to launch a new radio station.
sentence_gap: There are plans _____ to launch a new radio station.

explanation: a legal process in a law court where someone is accused of a particular crime and asked to say if they are guilty or not
sentence: She was in custody last night awaiting arraignment.
sentence_gap: She was in custody last night awaiting ___________.

explanation: to make the loud noise typical of a donkey
to begin a discussion of something difficult
sentence: At some point we've got to discuss money but I don't know how to broach the subject with him.
sentence_gap: At some point we've got to discuss money but I don't know how to ______ the subject with him.

sentence: The clarinet joins the oboe and is similarly out of synchronization.
sentence_gap: The ________ joins the oboe and is similarly out of synchronization.

explanation: to make someone feel slightly frightened or worried about their ability to achieve something
sentence: She was not at all daunted by the size of the problem.
sentence_gap: She was not at all _______ by the size of the problem.

explanation: formal; a word, especially an offensive word, that you use when you are angry or in pain
sentence: He dropped the book on his foot and muttered several expletives under his breath.
sentence_gap: He dropped the book on his foot and muttered several __________ under his breath.

explanation: to take a quick deep breath with your mouth open, especially because you are surprised or in pain
sentence: They gasped in astonishment at the news.
sentence_gap: They ______ in astonishment at the news.

explanation: formal; that cannot be proved wrong and that must therefore be accepted
sentence: Both strategies can apparently be justified by simple and apparently irrefutable arguments.
sentence_gap: Both strategies can apparently be justified by simple and apparently ___________ arguments.

explanation: formal; to cut or tear something, especially flesh
sentence: The man's face was severely lacerated in the accident.
sentence_gap: The man's face was severely _________ in the accident.

explanation: a bird or an animal that feeds on dead animals that it has not killed itself
sentence: Most dead birds are picked up by crows or other scavengers.
sentence_gap: Most dead birds are picked up by crows or other __________.

explanation: of very high quality and causing great admiration
sentence: The book has sublime descriptive passages.

explanation: to be strong enough, or not be changed by something, or to oppose a person or thing successfully
sentence: Our toys are designed to withstand the rough treatment of the average five-year-old.
sentence_gap: Our toys are designed to _________ the rough treatment of the average five-year-old.
